intro: Brodiaea dissimulata, commonly known as the masked brodiaea, is a flowering plant native to California and southern Oregon. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous underground stems. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Brodiaea dissimulata is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, making it a hardy and resilient species.
